column2: During your project, did the people in this group say they felt heard for the first time?
column9: Did they say they felt involved for the first time?
column16: Did they say they learned a lot about their community or organization?
column23: During your story collection, did these people seem to want to tell more stories than you collected?
column30: Did you ever feel that they wanted to share more experiences with each other than they did?
column37: Did these people feel that some of the stories you collected "needed to be heard" by anyone?
column43: Were there any issues that these people thought "nobody cares" about?
column49: Do the people in this group have needs that nobody can meet?
column55: Do these people need to start telling themselves new stories?
column61: Were there any issues about which the people in this group seemed to want to keep exploring?
column67: Did you discover any "crisis points" where people in this group needed help and didn't get it?
column73: Did you find any issues for this group that were beyond words, that no amount of discussion could resolve?
column79: Did these people say that they learned a lot about the topic by participating in the project?
column86: Did you notice that new members of the community or organization were having a harder time making sense of things?
column92: Were there any issues that these people found difficult to understand, even though abundant information was available?
column98: Did you discover any areas in which these people had more confidence than skill?
column104: Did any of these participants express an interest in learning more about story work?
